text: Speaking of Uniful.jl, I have written a UnitfulCurrencies.jl package (<https://github.com/rmsrosa/UnitfulCurrencies.jl>), but I have not registered it yet. I found out later that there is a UnitfulCurrency.jl, which, however, is marked as archived. So I am pondered whether I change the name of my package or keep it like that since the other one is archived. I am a bit reluctant, but I like the name I chose and can’t think of something more appropriate. Any thoughts?

text: it's already registered: <https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/tree/master/U/UnitfulCurrency> so I wouldn't consider using that name

so I wouldn't consider using that name

text: If it’s archived, perhaps we should look at un-registering it? Or is there another strategy to deal with good names being claimed by abandonded packages?

elements.text: If it’s archived, perhaps we should look at un-registering it? Or is there another strategy to deal with good names being claimed by abandonded packages?

text: I like the name `UnitfulCurrencies.jl`  and am not like the name `UnitfulCurrency.jl`

text: You can always try to contact the author of the other package and maybe take over that name.

text: but the git history should be the same, no?

elements.text: but the git history should be the same, no?

text: That can be arranged by just rebasing the new repo on the old. But it is not super important, the thing that matters is that the old trees are available in the new repo

elements.text: That can be arranged by just rebasing the new repo on the old. But it is not super important, the thing that matters is that the old trees are available in the new repo

text: Thanks for all the responses. I am not sure I understand the suggestion of taking over the name. I want to keep the plural form. I think I should either change the name or get some sort of “blessing” from Unitful.jl. I mean, if it is stated in the README.md that UnitfulCurrency.jl is archived and next in the list there is UnitfulCurrencies.jl, that should take care of part of the possible confusion. If, however, the main mantainers of Unitful.jl, including <@UDB26738Q>, think the latter is not an option, then I totally respect that. I am just a new kid on the block.

text:
> the main mantainers of Unitful.jl, including <@UDB26738Q>
I must note that at the moment I'm the _only_ maintainer, Andrew is missing in action :disappointed: (and I'm not incredibly happy about this, I'm not very familiar with the internals of the package)

text: Hmm, sorry to hear about that. What about Sebastian Stock? He just wrote UnitfulEquivalences.jl, after I asked about equivalences as in astropy, He seemed very knowledgeable about the package. I learned a lot from him. I also learned quite a bit about Uniftul.jl during some discussions about UnitfulEquivalences.jl and while writing UnitfulCurrencies.jl and UnitfulBrewing.jl (not ready yet), but I don’t think I am ready to seriously help with it. Hopefully some day.

text:
I'd love to see a reboot in the Unitful.jl ecosystem. Super useful functionality. Ricardo just because you're "new" doesn't mean people won't happily help/incorporate your contributions!
As Jeffrey Sarnoff once said "collaboration without consternation"
